intro: Psychotria glomerata, commonly known as the "cup-of-john" or "devil's snare," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Psychotria glomerata is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
